0.title: SubNews Theme & Mesh-Core Plugin - API Reference
0.content: Comprehensive documentation of all public hooks, filters, and extensibility points in the SubNews theme and mesh-core plugin.

1.title: Table of Contents
1.content: . | Introduction | Theme Action Hooks | Theme Filter Hooks | Plugin Action Hooks | Plugin Filter Hooks | Integration Hooks | Hook Naming Conventions | Usage Examples | Hook Statistics | .

2.title: Introduction
2.content: This reference documents all public hooks (actions and filters) exposed by the SubNews WordPress theme and mesh-core plugin. These hooks enable developers to extend and customize functionality without modifying core files.

3.title: Hook Naming Conventions
3.content: . | Theme hooks use the subnews_* prefix | Plugin hooks use the mesh_* or mtc_* prefixes | Content filters use patterns like subnews_the_* or subnews_get_* | Configuration filters use patterns like subnews_filter_* or mtc_* | .

4.title: Best Practices
4.content: . | Always check hook parameters before using them | Use appropriate priorities for multiple callbacks | Sanitize and escape all user input | Test hooks in a development environment first | Document custom implementations for team reference | .

5.title: Theme Action Hooks
5.content: Action hooks in the SubNews theme allow you to inject custom code at specific points in the page lifecycle.

32.title: Shared Filters Between Theme & Plugin
32.content: The following filters are shared for cross-compatibility: . | mesh_author_bio_avatar_size - Avatar size control | mtc_member_social_links - Team/member social links | Social links container/display - Theme and plugin both respect social link styling | .

33.title: Template Loading Integration
33.content: The plugin’s mtc_get_template_part() function uses performance hooks: . do_action( 'start_operation', 'mtc_get_template_part::' . $handle ); // Template part loads from: // 1. Child theme (if exists) // 2. Parent theme // 3. Plugin fallback do_action( 'end_operation', 'mtc_get_template_part::' . $handle ); .

34.title: Hook Interoperability
34.content: . | Both theme and plugin use subnews_opt() for theme options | Plugin respects theme settings for styling | Theme respects plugin shortcode output | Visual Composer integration is seamless between theme and plugin elements | .

36.title: Theme Naming Pattern: subnews_*
36.content: By Category: . | subnews_logo - Logo rendering | subnews_header_* - Header components | subnews_title_bar - Page title bar | subnews_footer_* - Footer components | subnews_social_* - Social features | subnews_author_* - Author-related | subnews_posts_* - Posts listing | subnews_related_* - Related content | subnews_the_* - Content filters (data output) | subnews_get_* - Data retrieval filters | subnews_filter_* - Specific filter hooks | subnews_navbar_* - Navigation customization | .

37.title: Plugin Naming Pattern: mesh_* & mtc_*
37.content: By Category: . | mesh_* - Core plugin functionality | mtc_* - MeshTheme Core extensions | mtc_vc_* - Visual Composer elements | mtc_view_count_* - View counting configuration | .

39.title: Example 1: Add Custom Content to Footer
39.content: add_action( 'subnews_before_wp_footer', 'my_footer_banner', 25 ); function my_footer_banner() { echo '<div class="custom-footer-banner">'; echo '<p>' . wp_kses_post( 'Custom footer content' ) . '</p>'; echo '</div>'; } .

40.title: Example 2: Customize Search Placeholder
40.content: add_filter( 'subnews_navbar_search_placeholder', 'my_search_placeholder' ); function my_search_placeholder( $placeholder ) { if ( is_archive() ) { return 'Search articles...'; } if ( function_exists( 'is_shop' ) && is_shop() ) { return 'Search products...'; } return 'What are you looking for?'; } .

41.title: Example 3: Modify Category Display
41.content: add_filter( 'subnews_the_category', 'my_category_badge', 10, 2 ); function my_category_badge( $html, $type ) { if ( 'single' === $type ) { return '<span class="category-badge">' . wp_kses_post( $html ) . '</span>'; } return $html; } .

42.title: Example 4: Configure View Counting
42.content: // Exclude admins from view counting add_filter( 'mtc_view_count_exclude_admins', '__return_true' ); // Set 50% sampling rate for performance add_filter( 'mtc_sampling_rate', function() { return 50; } ); // Use AJAX for cache compatibility add_filter( 'mtc_view_count_cache_support', '__return_true' ); .

43.title: Example 5: Add Before Sidebar Content
43.content: add_action( 'subnews_before_primary_sidebar', 'my_sidebar_ad', 10 ); function my_sidebar_ad() { echo '<div class="sidebar-advertisement">'; echo wp_kses_post( do_shortcode( '[adsense_placeholder]' ) ); echo '</div>'; } .

44.title: Example 6: Customize Pagination
44.content: add_filter( 'subnews_bootstrap_pagination_defaults', 'my_pagination_text' ); function my_pagination_text( $defaults ) { $defaults['prev_text'] = '← Newer Posts'; $defaults['next_text'] = 'Older Posts →'; return $defaults; } .

45.title: Example 7: Track Performance
45.content: add_action( 'start_operation', 'my_perf_start' ); function my_perf_start( $handle ) { global $my_perf; $my_perf[ $handle ] = microtime( true ); } add_action( 'end_operation', 'my_perf_end' ); function my_perf_end( $handle ) { global $my_perf; if ( isset( $my_perf[ $handle ] ) ) { $time = microtime( true ) - $my_perf[ $handle ]; error_log( $handle . ' took ' . $time . ' seconds' ); } } .

46.title: Example 8: Customize Social Links
46.content: add_filter( 'subnews_get_social_links_container', 'my_social_style' ); function my_social_style( $args ) { $args['style'] = '2'; // Icon style $args['align'] = 'justify-content-between'; // Bootstrap alignment $args['class'] = 'my-custom-social-links'; return $args; } .

52.title: Security
52.content: . | Always sanitize user input with sanitize_*() functions | Escape output with esc_html(), esc_attr(), esc_url() | Use wp_kses_post() for rich text content | Verify nonces for AJAX requests | Check capabilities with current_user_can() | .

53.title: Performance

91.title: Child Theme
91.content: A child theme inherits the look and feel of the parent theme and all of its functions, but can be used to make modifications to any part of the theme. In this way, customizations are kept separate from the parent theme’s files. Using a child theme lets you upgrade the parent theme without affecting the customizations you’ve made to your site.

93.content: . | Make your modifications portable and replicable; | Keep customization separate from parent theme functions; | Allow parent themes to be updated without destroying your modifications. | .

189.title: Getting Started with SubNews - Complete Guide
189.content: This comprehensive guide will walk you through everything you need to do to get your SubNews website up and running.

190.title: Table of Contents
190.content: . | Before You Begin | Installation Steps | Activate Required Plugins | Initial Theme Setup | Configure Theme Options | Set Up Your Homepage | Install Demo Content (Optional) | Next Steps | .

192.title: System Requirements
192.content: Before installing SubNews, make sure your hosting meets these requirements: . ✅ WordPress Version: 5.8 or higher ✅ PHP Version: 7.4 or higher ✅ MySQL: 5.6 or higher ✅ Disk Space: At least 100 MB ✅ Memory Limit: At least 256 MB (recommended 512 MB) .

193.title: Check Your WordPress Version
193.content: . | Log in to your WordPress dashboard | Go to Dashboard → Look at the bottom right corner | You’ll see your WordPress version | .

194.title: Check Your PHP Version
194.content: Contact your hosting provider to confirm your PHP version, or: . | Go to Tools → Site Health | Look for “PHP version” information | .

196.title: Step 1: Download SubNews Theme
196.content: . | Purchase SubNews from the theme provider | Download the theme ZIP file to your computer | Keep the ZIP file name as-is (usually subnews.zip) | .

197.title: Step 2: Install the Theme
197.content: Via WordPress Dashboard: . | Log in to your WordPress admin panel | Go to Appearance → Themes | Click Add New button | Click Upload Theme button | Choose the SubNews ZIP file from your computer | Click Install Now | Wait for installation to complete | Click Activate | . Or via FTP: . | Extract the SubNews ZIP file | Upload the subnews folder to /wp-content/themes/ via FTP | Go to Appearance → Themes in WordPress | Find SubNews and click Activate | .

198.title: Step 3: Verify Installation
198.content: After activation: . | Visit your website homepage | You should see the SubNews theme active | Check that the theme displays correctly | . ✅ Success! Your theme is now installed.

199.title: Activate Required Plugins
199.content: SubNews requires three plugins to work properly. WordPress will show notifications to install them.

200.title: Required Plugins
200.content: . | WPBakery Page Builder - Visual page builder | Mesh Core - Custom elements and functionality | Redux Framework - Theme options management | .

201.title: Installation Method 1: Automatic Installation
201.content: . | After activating SubNews, check the dashboard | You’ll see notifications about required plugins | Click the installation link in each notification | WordPress will automatically install and activate them | .

202.title: Installation Method 2: Manual Installation
202.content: . | Go to Plugins → Add New | Search for “WPBakery Page Builder” | Click Install Now and then Activate | Repeat for “Mesh Core” and “Redux Framework” | .

203.title: Recommended Plugins
203.content: These plugins enhance functionality but are optional: . | Contact Form 7 - Create contact forms | MailChimp for WordPress - Email newsletter signup | WooCommerce - Set up online store | One Click Demo Import - Import demo content | WordPress SEO by Yoast - SEO optimization | .

204.title: Initial Theme Setup
204.content: After installation, follow these steps to set up your theme: .

205.title: Step 1: Go to Theme Options
205.content: . | Log in to WordPress dashboard | Go to Appearance → SubNews Theme Options | You’ll see the theme customization panel | .

206.title: Step 2: Configure Basic Settings
206.content: Navigate through each section and configure: . Colors . | Click Colors section | Set your Primary Color (main brand color) | Set Secondary Color for accents | Save changes | . Logo & Favicon . | Click Logo section | Upload your website logo image | Set logo dimensions (recommended: 200x50 pixels) | Upload favicon (website icon in browser tab) | Save changes | . Header Layout . | Click Header section | Choose one of 6 header layout options | Configure header settings like sticky header | Save changes | . Footer . | Click Footer section | Configure footer layout | Update copyright text | Add footer widgets | .

207.title: Step 3: Save All Changes
207.content: After each section: . | Click Save Changes button | Wait for confirmation message | Check your website to see changes | .

209.title: Essential Sections to Configure
209.content: 1. Layout Settings . | Path: Appearance → SubNews Theme Options → Layout | Configure site width (boxed or full-width) | Set sidebar positions | Adjust padding and margins | . 2. Menu Settings . | Path: Appearance → SubNews Theme Options → Menu | Choose navigation menu display | Enable mega menu if desired | Configure mobile menu behavior | . 3. Blog Settings . | Path: Appearance → SubNews Theme Options → Blog | Choose blog layout (grid, list, or masonry) | Set posts per page | Configure pagination style | . 4. Typography . | Path: Appearance → SubNews Theme Options → Typography | Select fonts for headings | Select fonts for body text | Adjust font sizes if desired | . 5. WooCommerce (if using store) . | Path: Appearance → SubNews Theme Options → WooCommerce | Configure product layouts | Set up shopping cart options | Customize product pages | .

211.title: Create a Static Homepage
211.content: Instead of showing blog posts, create a custom homepage: . Step 1: Create Homepage Page . | Go to Pages → Add New | Enter title: “Home” | Build your homepage with page builder or shortcodes | Publish the page | . Step 2: Set as Homepage . | Go to Settings → Reading | Select “A static page” for homepage | Choose your new “Home” page | Save changes | . Step 3: Verify . | Visit your website homepage | You should see your custom page | Check that it displays correctly | .

212.title: Alternative: Keep Blog Homepage
212.content: If you prefer showing latest blog posts as homepage: . | Go to Settings → Reading | Select “Latest posts” | Save changes | Your blog will display on homepage | .

213.title: Install Demo Content (Optional)
213.content: SubNews includes demo content to help you get started quickly.

214.title: Step 1: Install Demo Importer Plugin
214.content: . | Go to Plugins → Add New | Search for “One Click Demo Import” | Click Install Now and Activate | .

215.title: Step 2: Import Demo Content
215.content: . | Go to Appearance → Import Demo Data | Choose the demo you like: . | Classic News Demo | Magazine Demo | Blog Demo | Portfolio Demo | . | Click Import | Wait for import to complete (this may take a few minutes) | .

216.title: Step 3: Verify Import
216.content: After import: . | Check your website homepage | You’ll see demo content and pages | You can edit or delete demo content | Start replacing with your own content | .

217.title: Note on Demo Content
217.content: . | Demo content is for reference only | You can delete it and start fresh | Keep demo posts to see layout examples | Customize colors and text to match your brand | .

219.title: After Installation
219.content: . | ✅ Install and activate theme | ✅ Install required plugins | ✅ Configure theme options | ✅ Set up homepage | ⬜ Create your content (next step) | .

220.title: What to Do Now
220.content: . | Create Blog Posts . | Go to Posts → Add New | Write your first blog post | Add featured image | Publish | . | Create Pages . | Go to Pages → Add New | Use page builder to create content | Add shortcodes for features | Publish | . | Set Up Navigation . | Go to Appearance → Menus | Create main menu | Assign menu to header location | . | Configure Settings . | Tagline: Settings → General | Timezone: Settings → General | Timezone: Settings → General | Date format: Settings → General | . | .

221.title: Recommended Guides to Read Next
221.content: . | Theme Features Overview - Learn all theme capabilities | Common Tasks Guide - Perform everyday functions | Shortcodes Guide - Use 40+ powerful elements | Customizing Header - Personalize your header | .

223.title: Problem: Theme Not Showing
223.content: Solution: . | Clear browser cache (Ctrl+Shift+Delete) | Go to Appearance → Themes | Verify SubNews is activated | Check WordPress version (must be 5.8+) | .

224.title: Problem: Plugins Won’t Install
224.content: Solution: . | Check your hosting memory limit (must be 256MB+) | Try installing one plugin at a time | Wait 30 seconds between plugin installations | Contact hosting provider if problem persists | .

225.title: Problem: Blank Page After Installation
225.content: Solution: . | Enable WordPress Debug (see troubleshooting guide) | Check error logs in /wp-content/debug.log | Disable all plugins except SubNews and required ones | Switch to default theme and back to SubNews | .

226.title: Problem: Missing Theme Options Menu
226.content: Solution: . | Make sure Redux Framework is activated | Go to Plugins → make sure it shows as Active | Deactivate and reactivate Redux Framework | Refresh WordPress dashboard | .

228.title: Need More Help?
228.content: . | FAQ: See User FAQ | Troubleshooting: See Troubleshooting Guide | Common Tasks: See Common Tasks Guide | .

230.title: Summary
230.content: You should now have: ✅ SubNews theme installed ✅ Required plugins activated ✅ Theme options configured ✅ Homepage set up ✅ Ready to create content . Congratulations! Your SubNews website is ready to use. 🎉 . Start creating your content and customizing the theme to match your brand! .

Includes: . | 22 Action Hooks - Extension points for custom code | 39+ Filter Hooks - Data modification and customization | Hook naming conventions and patterns | Complete parameter documentation | Usage examples for each hook | Integration patterns between theme and plugin | Best practices and security considerations | . 259.content: . | Review: Both theme and plugin documentation | Check: Integration Points section | Use: Shared hooks and filters from API Reference | Test: In both single theme and with plugin active | .

261.title: Add Custom Action Hook
261.content: Theme Example: . add_action( 'subnews_before_wp_footer', 'my_custom_footer_content', 15 ); function my_custom_footer_content() { echo '<div class="my-banner">' . wp_kses_post( $content ) . '</div>'; } . See API Reference - Action Hooks for all available hooks.

262.title: Filter Theme Options
262.content: Theme Example: . add_filter( 'subnews_navbar_search_placeholder', 'my_custom_placeholder' ); function my_custom_placeholder( $placeholder ) { return __( 'Search articles...', 'my-theme' ); } . See API Reference - Filter Hooks for all available filters.

263.title: Create Custom Shortcode
263.content: Plugin Pattern: . class My_Custom_Element { public function __construct() { if ( function_exists( 'vc_add_shortcode_param' ) ) { add_action( 'vc_before_init', array( $this, 'mapping' ) ); } add_shortcode( 'my_element', array( $this, 'render' ) ); } public function mapping() { vc_map( array( 'name' => 'My Element', 'base' => 'my_element', 'params' => array( /* parameters */ ), ) ); } public function render( $atts, $content = null ) { $atts = shortcode_atts( array( 'title' => 'Default Title', ), $atts ); return '<div>' . esc_html( $atts['title'] ) . '</div>'; } } new My_Custom_Element(); . See Mesh-Core Plugin Documentation - Shortcodes for more details.

264.title: Configure View Counting
264.content: Plugin Filters: . // Exclude admins from counting add_filter( 'mtc_view_count_exclude_admins', '__return_true' ); // Set 50% sampling rate for performance add_filter( 'mtc_sampling_rate', function() { return 50; } ); // Enable AJAX for cache compatibility add_filter( 'mtc_view_count_cache_support', '__return_true' ); . See API Reference - View Count Filters for more options.

266.title: Input Sanitization
266.content: Always sanitize user input: . $text = sanitize_text_field( $_POST['text'] ); $email = sanitize_email( $_POST['email'] ); $url = esc_url( $_POST['url'] ); .

267.title: Output Escaping
267.content: Always escape output: . echo esc_html( $text ); echo '<img alt="' . esc_attr( $alt ) . '" />'; echo '<a href="' . esc_url( $url ) . '">Link</a>'; echo wp_kses_post( $html_content ); .

268.title: Nonce Verification
268.content: Use nonces for form submissions and AJAX: . // Verify nonce check_ajax_referer( 'my_nonce', 'nonce_field' ); wp_verify_nonce( $_POST['nonce'], 'my_nonce' ); .

269.title: Capability Checks
269.content: Verify user capabilities for sensitive operations: . if ( ! current_user_can( 'manage_options' ) ) { wp_die( 'Unauthorized' ); } . See API Reference - Security for more details.

271.title: Theme Bootstrap Flow
271.content: . | functions.php loads includes/bootstrap.php | bootstrap.php loads all core classes | Classes instantiate as singletons: . | SubNews_Assets | SubNews_Menus | SubNews_Template_Functions | SubNews_Style_Generator | . | Redux options are loaded | Metaboxes are registered | AJAX handlers are registered | Hooks are registered via SubNews_*_Functions classes | .

272.title: Plugin Bootstrap Flow
272.content: . | mesh-core.php loads includes/bootstrap.php | bootstrap.php loads all core classes | Mesh_Core class initializes | Mesh_Core_Loader registers all hooks | Element classes auto-instantiate (register VC + shortcodes) | Widget classes auto-register | Helper functions are loaded | .

273.title: Hook System
273.content: graph LR A["Action Hook<br/>do_action"] B["Filter Hook<br/>apply_filters"] C["Callback Function"] D["Return Value"] E["Output/Result"] A -->|Registered| C B -->|Registered| C C --> D D --> E . See theme and plugin documentation for detailed architecture diagrams.

275.content: themes/subnews/ ├── Core (functions.php, bootstrap.php, class-subnews.php) ├── includes/ (Core classes and options) ├── template-parts/ (Reusable components) ├── page-templates/ (Page builder templates) ├── vc_templates/ (Visual Composer overrides) ├── assets/ (CSS, JS, images) └── languages/ (Translations) .

See full directory structure in: . | Theme Directory Structure | Plugin Directory Structure | .

AJAX requests failing: . | Verify nonce is correct | Check admin-ajax.php is accessible | Review browser console for errors | . Hooks not firing: . | Verify hook name is correct | Check callback function exists | Review priority and accepted_args | .

301.title: To install Subnews, there are two paths:
301.content: . | Installing Subnews by downloading theme files from ThemeForest | Installing a Subnews Theme With File-Transfer Protocol (FTP) | . Need Help to WordPress installation? Read More .

302.title: Installing Subnews by downloading theme files from ThemeForest
302.content: Downloaded the theme after you initial purchased it & extract the zip file. You will get the subnews.zip file which is the main Subnews theme file. The subnews.zip file is the one you want to upload to WordPress. | Ensure you have the subnews.zip file. | Login to your WordPress admin & Navigate to Appearance > Themes. | On the themes page, select Add New at the top of the page | After clicking on the Add New button, select the Upload Theme button. | Upload and install the subnews.zip file. | Click Activate once complete. | .

303.title: Installing a Subnews Theme With File-Transfer Protocol (FTP)
303.content: . | Download FTP Client to your computer. | Create an FTP account through your hosting provider. | Download your subnews theme and unzip the file. | Upload the subnews theme folder to WordPress to install. | Activate the theme from your WordPress dashboard. | .

304.title: Introduction
304.content: . | About the Theme | Subnews Admin Welcome Panel | . Thank you for purchasing our theme, Subnews Theme. We’ve put in lots of love in developing this WordPress theme and are excited that you’ve chosen this theme for your website. We hope you find it easy to use our theme. This documentation guides you through the main features of the theme and guides you how to use and customize Subnews.

305.title: About the Theme
305.content: Subnews WordPress theme is a WooCommerce WordPress theme designed and developed for use with WordPress 5.8 or higher. The code was written to be backwards compatible where possible, however we recommend you use the current WP version when possible. If you are not using WordPress 5.8 or higher and can upgrade your site we recommend you do this before installation. Although every effort has been made to ensure the theme is bug free and easy to use there is always a chance errors may occur. If you do find a problem please notify us immediately through our Subnews Support - Submit a Ticket so we can ensure it gets fixed as quickly as possible.

325.title: Mesh-Core WordPress Plugin - Complete Technical Documentation
325.content: Version: 1.0.0 Author: MeshTheme License: GPL v2 or later Purpose: Extension plugin providing 40+ custom shortcode elements, custom post types, widgets, and theme functionality for MeshTheme WordPress themes Compatibility: SubNews, Mesh, and other MeshTheme themes .

326.title: Table of Contents
326.content: . | Overview | Directory Structure | Architecture | Bootstrap & Initialization | Custom Post Types & Taxonomies | Shortcodes System | Visual Composer Integration | Widgets System | Core Classes | Helper Functions | Security Implementations | Database Interactions | Asset Management | Integration Points | Developer Hooks & Filters | .

327.title: Overview
327.content: Mesh-Core is a comprehensive WordPress plugin that extends MeshTheme WordPress themes with advanced functionality. It provides a library of 40+ custom Visual Composer elements (shortcodes), custom post types, widgets, and social media integration.

328.title: Key Features
328.content: . | 40+ Visual Composer Elements - Pre-built page building components | 34+ Shortcodes - Versatile content elements | Custom Post Type - Portfolio management | 3 WordPress Widgets - Tab widget, posts widget, author widget | View Counter System - Track post popularity | Social Media Integration - Share buttons and social links | WooCommerce Support - Product carousels and shortcodes | Performance Hooks - Track template loading performance | WPML Compatible - Multilingual support | Security First - Input sanitization, nonce verification | .

329.title: Statistics
329.content: . | 40+ shortcode elements - Full page building library | 34+ shortcodes - Direct content insertion | 2,553 instances - Sanitization functions | 77 layout preview images - Admin interface previews | 90+ section separators - Design variations | 1 CPT, 1 taxonomy - Content organization | 3 WordPress widgets - Sidebar functionality | .

344.title: Shortcode Architecture Pattern
344.content: Each element class follows this pattern: . class Mesh_Element_Name { public function __construct() { // Hook into VC if ( function_exists( 'vc_add_shortcode_param' ) ) { add_action( 'vc_before_init', array( $this, 'mapping' ) ); } // Register shortcode add_shortcode( 'mtc_element', array( $this, 'render' ) ); } public function mapping() { // VC element mapping vc_map( array( 'name' => 'Element Name', 'base' => 'mtc_element', 'icon' => 'icon-url', 'category' => 'Category', 'params' => array( /* parameters */ ), ) ); } public function render( $atts, $content = null ) { // Shortcode output $atts = shortcode_atts( array( 'param1' => 'default', 'param2' => 'default', ), $atts ); // Sanitization & escaping $param1 = sanitize_text_field( $atts['param1'] ); // Output $html = '<div class="element">' . wp_kses_post( $content ) . '</div>'; return $html; } } new Mesh_Element_Name(); .

363.title: Sanitization
363.content: 2,553 instances of sanitization across element files: . // HTML content wp_kses_post( $content ) // HTML output esc_html( $text ) // HTML attributes esc_attr( $attribute ) // URLs esc_url( $url ) // JavaScript esc_js( $script ) // Text fields sanitize_text_field( $text ) // Textarea sanitize_textarea_field( $textarea ) // Email sanitize_email( $email ) // File paths sanitize_file_name( $filename ) // HTML wp_kses_allowed_html( 'post' ) .

364.title: Example Sanitization Pattern
364.content: Team Member Element: . $name = sanitize_text_field( $atts['name'] ); $bio = wp_kses_post( $atts['bio'] ); $url = esc_url( $atts['url'] ); $target = esc_attr( $atts['target'] ); $size = absint( $atts['size'] ); echo '<h3>' . esc_html( $name ) . '</h3>'; echo '<p>' . wp_kses_post( $bio ) . '</p>'; echo '<a href="' . esc_url( $url ) . '" target="' . esc_attr( $target ) . '">'; echo esc_html( __( 'View Profile', 'mesh-core' ) ) . '</a>'; .

365.title: Nonce Verification
365.content: Tab Widget AJAX: . if ( ! isset( $_POST['_nonce'] ) || ! wp_verify_nonce( $_POST['_nonce'], 'mtc_view_count_nonce' ) ) { wp_send_json_error( 'Invalid nonce' ); } . Note: Some AJAX handlers lack nonce verification - security can be enhanced .

366.title: Capability Checks

367.title: Direct Access Protection

WooCommerce Products with Cache: . $transient_name = 'mtc_wc_product_loop_' . substr( md5( wp_json_encode( $args ) ), 24 ); $products = get_transient( $transient_name ); if ( ! $products ) { $products = new WP_Query( $args ); set_transient( $transient_name, $products, DAY_IN_SECONDS * 30 ); } .

442.title: Server Requirements for Subnews
442.content: To run Subnews, we recommend be the latest version of WordPress is up and running. If you are not with latest version of WordPress just make sure you are running at least WordPress 5.8 or higher. WordPress recommend: . | PHP version 7.4 or greater. | MySQL version 5.6 or greater OR MariaDB version 10.1 or greater. | HTTPS support | . To know more about wordpress recomendation. See More.

443.title: Increasing the WordPress Memory Limit for WooCommerce
443.content: To address memory limit issues, there are two paths: . | Do It Yourself | Contact Your Host | .

444.title: Do It Yourself
444.content: To adjust on your own, here are some methods to try. Be aware that this section requires advanced knowledge; it is not basic.

445.title: Edit your wp-config.php file
445.content: Add this to the top, before the line that says, “Happy Blogging”: . define('WP_MEMORY_LIMIT', '256M'); . WordPress memory can be different from the server – you need to set this regardless of server memory settings . Read More About Editing wp-config.php .

446.title: Edit your PHP.ini file
446.content: If you have access to your PHP.ini file, change the line in PHP.ini If your line shows 64M try 256M: . memory_limit = 256M ; Maximum amount of memory a script may consume (64MB) .

447.title: Edit your .htaccess file
447.content: If you don’t have access to PHP.ini try adding this to an .htaccess file: . php_value memory_limit 256M .

448.title: Contact Your Host
448.content: Should you not feel comfortable in trying the above methods, or the above did not work for you, you need to talk to your hosting about having them increase your memory limit.

450.title: Complete Guide to SubNews Shortcodes & Elements
450.content: SubNews includes 40+ powerful shortcodes and elements to create stunning pages. This guide shows you how to use them all.

451.title: Table of Contents
451.content: . | What Are Shortcodes? | How to Add Shortcodes | Content Elements | Media Elements | UI Elements | Team & Social Elements | Product Elements | Shortcodes Reference | .

452.title: What Are Shortcodes?
452.content: Shortcodes are simple codes that display complex content. Instead of coding, you use simple shortcuts.

453.title: Shortcode Syntax
453.content: Shortcodes look like this: . [mtc_news_block columns="3" posts="9"] .

454.title: Two Ways to Use Shortcodes
454.content: 1. Visual Composer (Page Builder) . | Click “Add” button | Choose element | Configure settings visually | Easy for beginners | . 2. Direct Code (Advanced) . | Copy shortcode | Paste into page content | Edit parameters | Powerful and flexible | .

456.title: Method 1: Using Page Builder (Easiest)
456.content: . | Edit or create a page | Click Visual Composer tab | Click Add button | Search for element name | Click to add element | Configure element settings | Save changes | .

457.title: Method 2: Add Element Directly

508.title: Overview
508.content: SubNews is a modern, feature-rich WordPress theme designed for news, magazine, and content-focused websites. It includes extensive customization options through Redux Framework, deep Visual Composer integration, and a companion plugin (mesh-core) for advanced functionality.

509.title: Key Features
509.content: . | Responsive Design - Bootstrap 5.3.2 framework | Multiple Layouts - 6 header layouts, 24 blog block variations | Visual Page Builder - WPBakery Page Builder integration with 40+ custom elements | Theme Options - Redux Framework with 22 configuration sections | Metabox System - CMB2 for page/post customization | AJAX Features - Load more, block pagination, search | WooCommerce Ready - Full e-commerce support | Portfolio Support - Custom post type via mesh-core | Security First - Nonces, capabilities, sanitization throughout | .

510.content: . | 151 PHP files - Organized in includes/ subdirectory | 10,094+ lines - Core functionality code | 25+ classes - Object-oriented architecture | 32 template parts - Reusable template components | 19 action hooks - WordPress hook integration points | 22+ filter hooks - Data modification and customization | 5 menu locations - Navigation registration | 7+ widget areas - Dynamic sidebar support | .

550.title: AJAX Handlers
550.content: File: includes/functions/theme-ajax.php . Blog Load More . Action: mtc_blog_load_more Method: POST Nonce: mtc_blog_load_more . Parameters: . $_GET['page'] // Current page (int) - absint() $_GET['layout'] // Blog layout (string) - sanitize_text_field() $_GET['columns'] // Grid columns (int) - absint() $_GET['query'] // WP_Query args (JSON) - json_decode() $_GET['offset'] // Post offset (int) - absint() . Security: . check_ajax_referer( 'mtc_blog_load_more', 'nonce' ); $paged = isset( $_GET['page'] ) ? absint( wp_unslash( $_GET['page'] ) ) : 1; $layout = isset( $_GET['layout'] ) ? sanitize_text_field( wp_unslash( $_GET['layout'] ) ) : ''; . Response: HTML content + pagination markup . Block Pagination . Action: mtc_block_next_prev Method: POST Nonce: mtc_blog_load_more . Parameters: . $_GET['page'] // Page number (int) $_GET['layout'] // Block layout (string) $_GET['tlength'] // Title length (int) $_GET['clength'] // Content length (int) $_GET['tab_id'] // Category filter ID (string) $_GET['args'] // Query arguments (JSON) . Security: . check_ajax_referer( 'mtc_blog_load_more', 'nonce' ); // Input sanitization and validation . Response: HTML content + pagination + metadata .

551.title: AJAX Security
551.content: Nonce Verification: . check_ajax_referer( 'mtc_blog_load_more', 'nonce' ); // Fails silently if nonce is invalid . Input Sanitization: . $paged = isset( $_GET['page'] ) ? absint( wp_unslash( $_GET['page'] ) ) : 1; $layout = isset( $_GET['layout'] ) ? sanitize_text_field( wp_unslash( $_GET['layout'] ) ) : ''; $columns = isset( $_GET['columns'] ) ? absint( wp_unslash( $_GET['columns'] ) ) : 0; .

667.title: SubNews - Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
667.content: Get answers to the most common questions from SubNews users.

668.title: Table of Contents
668.content: . | Installation & Setup | Theme Features | Customization | Content & Pages | Performance | Security | Technical Issues | .

670.title: Q: Do I need any special hosting to use SubNews?
670.content: A: SubNews works on standard WordPress hosting. You need: . | WordPress 5.8 or higher | PHP 7.4 or higher | At least 256 MB memory limit (512 MB recommended) | MySQL 5.6 or higher | . Most modern hosting providers offer these specifications by default.

671.title: Q: What plugins are required?
671.content: A: Three plugins are required: . | WPBakery Page Builder - Page building | Mesh Core - Custom shortcodes and elements | Redux Framework - Theme options management | . These should be installed automatically after activating SubNews. If not, install manually from Plugins menu.

672.title: Q: Can I use SubNews with a child theme?
672.content: A: Yes! Child themes are recommended for customization. A child theme: . | Keeps your customizations safe during updates | Allows easy theme updates | Best practice for WordPress | . See Getting Started guide for child theme setup.

673.title: Q: Where do I find the theme options?
673.content: A: Go to Appearance → SubNews Theme Options in WordPress dashboard. All theme customization options are there.

674.title: Q: Can I import demo content?
674.content: A: Yes! Install “One Click Demo Import” plugin, then go to Appearance → Import Demo Data. Choose a demo and import. Takes 2-5 minutes depending on content size.

676.title: Q: What are the different header layouts?
676.content: A: SubNews includes 6 header layouts: . | Standard Horizontal - Logo left, menu right | Minimal Centered - Logo and menu centered | Full-Width Search - Search integrated in header | Magazine Style - Large featured header | Search Focused - Search as main feature | Mega Menu - Extended menu system | . Change via Appearance → SubNews Theme Options → Header.

677.title: Q: How many blog layouts are available?
677.content: A: Four blog layouts: . | Full Width - Full-width post cards | Grid - Multi-column card layout | Grid Masonry - Dynamic masonry layout | List - Traditional list format | . Plus 9 different “block” styles. Change via SubNews Theme Options → Blog.

678.title: Q: Does SubNews support WooCommerce?
678.content: A: Yes! SubNews is fully compatible with WooCommerce. Install WooCommerce plugin and configure product settings in SubNews Theme Options → WooCommerce.

679.title: Q: Can I use SubNews for a portfolio?
679.content: A: Yes! SubNews includes portfolio functionality: . | Custom portfolio post type | Portfolio archive page | Multiple layout options | Category filtering | Image galleries | . Configure in SubNews Theme Options → Portfolio.

680.title: Q: How do I add a contact form?
680.content: A: Use Contact Form 7 plugin: . | Install Contact Form 7 plugin | Go to Contact → Add New | Build your form | Copy shortcode | Paste into page/post | . See Contact Form Guide for detailed steps.

681.title: Q: What shortcodes are available?
681.content: A: SubNews includes 40+ shortcodes including: . | News blocks | Carousels (posts, portfolio, products) | Media (images, videos, maps) | UI elements (counters, timers, pricing tables) | Team/testimonials | Social elements | . See Shortcodes Guide for complete list.

683.title: Q: Can I change the theme colors without coding?
683.content: A: Yes! Go to Appearance → SubNews Theme Options → Colors. Change: . | Primary color | Secondary color | Text colors | Background colors | . No coding required! .

684.title: Q: How do I upload my own logo?
684.content: A: Go to Appearance → SubNews Theme Options → Logo and click Upload Logo. Upload your logo image (recommended: 200x50 pixels).

685.title: Q: Can I use a custom header image?
685.content: A: Yes! You can set custom header image: . | Go to Appearance → SubNews Theme Options → Header | Upload background image | Or customize per-page in metaboxes | .

686.title: Q: How do I customize fonts?
686.content: A: Go to Appearance → SubNews Theme Options → Typography: . | Choose heading fonts (Google Fonts) | Choose body fonts | Adjust font sizes | Set line heights | .

687.title: Q: Can I add custom CSS?
687.content: A: Yes! Go to Appearance → SubNews Theme Options → Custom Code and add CSS. Can also add per-page in page metaboxes.

688.title: Q: How do I make a full-width page?
688.content: A: When creating/editing page: . | Go to Page Attributes | Choose Full Width template | Publish page | . Or use page metabox to customize sidebar per-page.

690.title: Q: How do I create a homepage?
690.content: A: Two options: . Option 1: Static Homepage . | Create new page titled “Home” | Build with page builder | Go to Settings → Reading | Select “A static page” | Choose your Home page | . Option 2: Blog Homepage . | Go to Settings → Reading | Select “Latest posts” | Blog displays on homepage | .

691.title: Q: How do I add a blog to my website?
691.content: A: Blog is built-in: . | Go to Posts → Add New | Write post content | Add featured image | Choose category | Publish | . Posts automatically appear in blog section.

692.title: Q: How do I organize content with categories?
692.content: A: Create categories for posts: . | Go to Posts → Categories | Click Add New Category | Enter name and description | When creating post, select category | Posts grouped by category | .

693.title: Q: Can I have sub-categories?
693.content: A: Yes! When creating category: . | Enter category name | Choose Parent Category from dropdown | Creates sub-category hierarchy | .

694.title: Q: What’s the difference between Posts and Pages?
694.content: A: . | Posts - Blog articles, show in blog section, can have categories/tags | Pages - Static content, don’t appear in blog, good for About/Contact | .

695.title: Q: Can I schedule a post to publish later?
695.content: A: Yes! . | When editing post | Find Publish button (right side) | Click Edit next to date | Set future date and time | Click Schedule | . Post publishes automatically at scheduled time.

696.title: Q: How do I password protect a page?
696.content: A: When editing page/post: . | Find Publish section | Click Edit next to visibility | Choose Password protected | Enter password | Click OK | . Visitors must enter password to see content.

698.title: Q: My site is slow, what can I do?
698.content: A: Try these optimization steps: . | Use Caching Plugin - WP Super Cache or W3 Total Cache | Optimize Images - Compress before uploading | Limit Plugins - Only use necessary plugins | Use CDN - Distribute content globally | Clean Database - Remove unused posts/media | Disable Unused Features - Turn off features you don’t need | . See Performance Tips for detailed guide.

699.title: Q: How do I optimize images?
699.content: A: . | Resize to appropriate dimensions (not larger than 1920px wide) | Compress before uploading (use TinyPNG, ImageOptim) | Use appropriate format: . | Photos: JPG | Graphics: PNG | Modern browsers: WebP | . | Add alt text for SEO | .

700.title: Q: What’s the best caching plugin?
700.content: A: Popular options: . | WP Super Cache - Simple, effective | W3 Total Cache - Powerful, advanced | WP Rocket - Premium, user-friendly | LiteSpeed Cache - If using LiteSpeed hosting | . All work well with SubNews.

701.title: Q: Should I use a CDN?
701.content: A: Yes, if: . | You have visitors worldwide | You have lots of images/media | Want to reduce server load | . Popular CDNs: Cloudflare, MaxCDN, Bunny CDN .

703.title: Q: Is SubNews secure?
703.content: A: Yes! SubNews includes: . | Input sanitization | Output escaping | Nonce verification | SQL injection prevention | XSS protection | . See Security Best Practices for more.

704.title: Q: How do I keep my site secure?
704.content: A: Follow these steps: . | Keep WordPress Updated - Always update core, plugins, themes | Use Strong Passwords - 12+ characters, mix of letters/numbers/symbols | Regular Backups - Backup daily/weekly | Security Plugin - Use WordPress security plugin | Limit Login Attempts - Prevent brute force attacks | Two-Factor Auth - Enable 2FA for admin accounts | Remove Unused Plugins - Less code = fewer vulnerabilities | .

705.title: Q: How often should I backup?
705.content: A: Backup frequency depends on update frequency: . | High-traffic sites - Daily backups | Regular blogs - Weekly backups | Rarely updated - Monthly backups | . Test backup restoration monthly.

706.title: Q: What’s the best backup plugin?
706.content: A: Popular options: . | UpdraftPlus - Free and premium | BackWPup - Free, powerful | Duplicator - Free, great for migrations | BackupBuddy - Premium, automatic | . All work with SubNews.

708.title: Q: I see “Parse error” or “Syntax error”
708.content: A: . | Check PHP version (must be 7.4+) | Check memory limit (must be 256MB+) | Deactivate plugins except SubNews and required ones | Switch to default WordPress theme temporarily | Enable debug mode (see debug guide) | Check debug log: /wp-content/debug.log | .

709.title: Q: Shortcodes display as plain text
709.content: A: . | Make sure Mesh Core plugin is activated | Refresh page and clear browser cache | Disable caching plugins temporarily | Check shortcode syntax is correct | Try in Visual Composer to verify | .

710.title: Q: Page builder not loading
710.content: A: . | Check WPBakery is activated | Try deactivating browser extensions | Clear browser cache completely | Try different browser | Check memory limit | Check PHP version | .

711.title: Q: Images not showing on website
711.content: A: . | Check image URL is correct | Verify image file exists on server | Check file permissions (644 or 755) | Try uploading image again | Check image size (might be too large) | Verify media folder exists | .

712.title: Q: Contact form not sending emails
712.content: A: . | Check email address in form settings | Check email in Contact Form 7 | Check spam/junk folder | Test with different email address | Contact hosting provider if still fails | .

713.title: Q: Menu items not showing
713.content: A: . | Check menu is created | Check menu items are added | Check menu is assigned to location | Check parent items aren’t hidden | Clear browser cache | Check CSS/JavaScript isn’t blocking menu | .

714.title: Q: Theme customizer not working
714.content: A: . | Check Redux Framework is activated | Refresh dashboard | Try different browser | Clear browser cache completely | Deactivate plugins temporarily | Check memory limit is sufficient | .

743.title: Troubleshooting Guide - Fix Common Issues
743.content: This guide helps you solve common problems with SubNews theme.

744.title: Table of Contents
744.content: . | Before You Start | Installation Issues | Display Issues | Performance Issues | Functionality Issues | Plugin Conflicts | Security Issues | Getting Help | .

746.title: First Steps for Any Issue
746.content: Step 1: Clear Browser Cache . | Windows: Press Ctrl + Shift + Delete | Mac: Press Cmd + Shift + Delete | Or check your browser settings | . Step 2: Check WordPress Version . | Log in to dashboard | Check bottom right for version | Must be 5.8 or higher | Update if needed | . Step 3: Check PHP Version . | Go to Tools → Site Health | Look for PHP version | Must be 7.4 or higher | Contact hosting if too old | . Step 4: Enable Debug Mode . | Edit wp-config.php | Find define('WP_DEBUG', false); | Change to define('WP_DEBUG', true); | Add: define('WP_DEBUG_LOG', true); | Check /wp-content/debug.log for errors | .

748.title: Problem: Theme Won’t Install
748.content: Cause: File permissions or size limits . Solution: . | Check WordPress memory limit: . | Go to Tools → Site Health | Look for “Memory limit” | Should be 256MB or higher | . | Try uploading smaller files first | Use FTP instead of WordPress: . | Extract theme ZIP | Upload folder to /wp-content/themes/ | Go to Themes, activate SubNews | . | Contact hosting if still fails | .

749.title: Problem: Theme Appears Corrupted After Installation
749.content: Cause: Incomplete download or extraction . Solution: . | Delete theme folder via FTP | Re-download theme ZIP | Verify file integrity (check file size) | Extract again | Upload to /wp-content/themes/ | Go to Themes, activate SubNews | .

750.title: Problem: Required Plugins Won’t Install
750.content: Cause: Memory limit or conflicts . Solution: . | Check memory limit (must be 512MB+ recommended) | Install one plugin at a time | Wait 1 minute between installations | Try installing via FTP: . | Download plugin ZIP | Upload to /wp-content/plugins/ | Go to Plugins, activate | . | Contact hosting if needed | .

751.title: Problem: Can’t Find Theme Options Menu
751.content: Cause: Redux Framework not activated . Solution: . | Go to Plugins menu | Find “Redux Framework” | Check it’s “Active” | If not, click “Activate” | Go to Appearance menu | “SubNews Theme Options” should appear | If not, refresh page | .

753.title: Problem: Website Shows Blank Page
753.content: Cause: PHP error or memory limit . Solution: . | Enable debug mode (see Before You Start) | Check /wp-content/debug.log for errors | Increase memory limit: . | Edit wp-config.php | Add: define('WP_MEMORY_LIMIT', '512M'); | . | Deactivate all plugins except SubNews and required ones | Switch to default theme, then back to SubNews | Check with hosting provider | .

754.title: Problem: Theme Shows But Colors Are Wrong
754.content: Cause: Theme options not saved or conflicting CSS . Solution: . | Go to SubNews Theme Options | Click Colors section | Verify colors are set | Click Save Changes | Clear browser cache | Check that custom CSS doesn’t override colors | .

755.title: Problem: Images Not Displaying
755.content: Cause: Wrong file permissions or broken links . Solution: . | Check image URL: . | Go to Media | Hover image, get URL | Paste in browser address bar | Should show image | . | Fix file permissions: . | Via FTP, check image files are 644 | Check folders are 755 | . | Re-upload image: . | Delete image from Media | Upload again | . | Check image size: . | Images must be under 5MB | Resize if too large | . | .

756.title: Problem: Header Layout Not Changing
756.content: Cause: Cache or CSS issue . Solution: . | Go to SubNews Theme Options → Header | Choose different layout | Save Changes | Clear browser cache (Ctrl+Shift+Delete) | Wait 30 seconds | Refresh website | If using caching plugin, clear its cache | .

757.title: Problem: Blog Layout Looks Wrong
757.content: Cause: CSS issue or conflicting plugin . Solution: . | Go to SubNews Theme Options → Blog | Choose layout | Save Changes | Clear all caches: . | Browser cache | Plugin cache (if using) | Server cache | . | Disable caching plugins temporarily | Check custom CSS in theme options | .

758.title: Problem: Menu Not Showing Correctly
758.content: Cause: Menu not assigned or CSS issue . Solution: . | Go to Appearance → Menus | Check menu is assigned to location | Edit menu, verify items are added | Check menu items aren’t password protected | Clear browser cache | Check for CSS conflicts in custom code | Disable plugins that affect menus | .

760.title: Problem: Website Loading Slowly
760.content: Cause: Large images, no caching, too many plugins . Solution Priority: . 1. Install Caching Plugin . | Go to Plugins → Add New | Search “WP Super Cache” | Install and Activate | Settings are automatic | . 2. Optimize Images . | Use tool like TinyPNG.com | Compress all images before uploading | Resize to appropriate dimensions | Use JPG for photos, PNG for graphics | . 3. Disable Unused Plugins . | Plugins use memory | Only keep necessary ones | Deactivate unused plugins | . 4. Use CDN (Optional) . | Sign up for Cloudflare (free) | Changes DNS settings | Speeds up delivery globally | . 5. Clean Database . | Go to Tools → Cleanup Database | Or use cleanup plugin | Remove old revisions | .

761.title: Problem: Images Loading Slowly
761.content: Cause: Large file sizes . Solution: . | Compress images before uploading | Use online tool: . | Visit TinyPNG.com | Upload images | Download compressed versions | Re-upload to WordPress | . | Delete uncompressed versions | Use lazy loading: . | Go to SubNews Theme Options | Enable lazy loading | Save changes | . | .

762.title: Problem: Page Builder Slow to Load
762.content: Cause: Large page with many elements . Solution: . | Reduce number of elements on page | Break page into multiple pages | Use simple layouts | Optimize images | Disable extra plugins | Increase memory limit to 512MB | .

764.title: Problem: Shortcodes Display as Text
764.content: Cause: Plugin not active or syntax error . Solution: . | Check Mesh Core plugin is activated | Check shortcode syntax is correct | Try copying shortcode from page builder instead of typing | Clear browser cache | Disable caching plugins | Check for PHP errors (enable debug mode) | .

765.title: Problem: Page Builder Not Opening
765.content: Cause: WPBakery not activated or browser issue . Solution: . | Check WPBakery is activated | Go to Plugins, find WPBakery | Should show “Deactivate” link | If shows “Activate”, click it | Try different browser | Disable browser extensions: . | AdBlock, uBlock Origin, etc. | Disable temporarily | Try page builder again | . | Clear browser cache completely | Restart browser | .

766.title: Problem: Contact Form Not Sending Email
766.content: Cause: Mail server or form configuration issue . Solution: . | Check email address in form: . | Go to Contact Forms 7 → edit form | Click “Mail” tab | Verify “To” email address | Should be your admin email | . | Test form: . | Go to page with form | Fill it out | Submit | Check inbox and spam folder | . | If no email arrives: . | Check hosting supports email | Try different email address | Contact hosting provider | . | Check form isn’t password protected | .

767.title: Problem: Search Not Working
767.content: Cause: Search configuration or plugin conflict . Solution: . | Go to SubNews Theme Options → Search | Enable search functionality | Save Changes | Test search on website | If still not working: . | Disable plugins except SubNews + required | Test again | Enable plugins one by one until finds culprit | . | Check WordPress posts are published | .

768.title: Problem: Related Posts Not Showing
768.content: Cause: Configuration or no related content . Solution: . | Go to SubNews Theme Options → Blog | Enable “Related Posts” | Save Changes | Check post has categories | Check other posts in same category exist | Related posts automatically show on single post | If still not showing: . | Check post isn’t password protected | Check categories are assigned | Clear all caches | . | .

769.title: Problem: WooCommerce Products Not Showing
769.content: Cause: WooCommerce not activated or products not published . Solution: . | Check WooCommerce is installed and activated | Check products are published: . | Go to Products | Verify products show | . | Check products are in category: . | Edit product | Assign category | Save | . | Go to shop page | Products should display | If not: . | Check theme options WooCommerce settings | Clear all caches | Disable plugins except SubNews + WooCommerce | . | .

771.title: Problem: Two Plugins Conflicting
771.content: Cause: Plugin incompatibility or code conflict . Solution: . | Identify which plugins conflict (usually 2 plugins) | Deactivate one plugin | Test if issue goes away | If yes, you found culprit | Options: . | Use different plugin | Contact plugin developer | Disable one plugin | . | . To Find Conflicting Plugin: . | Deactivate all plugins except SubNews + required ones | Test if problem gone | Activate plugins one by one | Test after each activation | When problem reappears, found culprit | Disable that plugin | .

772.title: Problem: Plugin Causes White Screen
772.content: Cause: Memory limit or incompatible plugin . Solution: . | Increase memory limit: . | Edit wp-config.php | Add: define('WP_MEMORY_LIMIT', '512M'); | . | Deactivate all plugins except SubNews + required | Activate plugins one by one | When problem reappears, found culprit | Delete or replace that plugin | .

773.title: Problem: Plugin Breaks Page Builder
773.content: Cause: Plugin modifies core functionality . Solution: . | Deactivate all non-essential plugins | Test page builder | Activate plugins one by one | Test after each | When breaks, found culprit | Disable that plugin | Try alternative plugin if available | .

775.title: Problem: Site Hacked or Compromised
775.content: Cause: Weak password, outdated software, or malicious plugin . Solution: . | Change all passwords immediately: . | WordPress admin | FTP/SFTP | cPanel | Database | . | Restore from clean backup (before hack) | Check for malicious plugins: . | Go to Plugins | Look for suspicious plugins | Delete if necessary | . | Update everything: . | WordPress core | All plugins | Theme | . | Install security plugin: . | Wordfence (free) | Sucuri (free) | . | Scan for malware | .

776.title: Problem: Suspicious Plugin Detected
776.content: Cause: Compromised or malicious code . Solution: . | Deactivate plugin immediately | Delete plugin | Search plugin name online | Check if it’s known malware | If legitimate, reinstall fresh copy from WordPress.org | Install security plugin to scan site | Change all passwords | .

777.title: Problem: Brute Force Attack (Many Login Attempts)
777.content: Cause: Weak admin password . Solution: . | Change admin password to strong one: . | 12+ characters | Mix of letters, numbers, symbols | Unique password | . | Install security plugin: . | Wordfence | iThemes Security | . | Enable two-factor authentication | Limit login attempts: . | Wordfence has this built-in | . | Change login URL: . | Use security plugin | Makes harder to find | . | .

779.title: Error: “Fatal error: allowed memory size exhausted”
779.content: Solution: . | Edit wp-config.php | Add: define('WP_MEMORY_LIMIT', '512M'); | Or increase memory limit with hosting provider | .

780.title: Error: “Maximum execution time exceeded”
780.content: Solution: . | Edit wp-config.php | Add: set_time_limit(300); | Or contact hosting provider to increase | .

781.title: Error: “Can’t connect to database”
781.content: Solution: . | Check database credentials in wp-config.php | Verify database exists | Check database user permissions | Contact hosting provider | .

782.title: Error: “Undefined index” or “Undefined variable”
782.content: Solution: . | Enable debug mode | Check /wp-content/debug.log | Usually not critical, just warnings | Contact plugin developer if in plugin | .

783.title: Error: “Your site has experienced a critical error”
783.content: Solution: . | Enable debug mode (see Before You Start) | Check debug.log for error details | Increase memory limit | Deactivate plugins | Check PHP version | Contact hosting provider | .

785.title: Enable Debug Mode
785.content: . | Edit file: wp-config.php (in root directory) | Find: define('WP_DEBUG', false); | Change to: define('WP_DEBUG', true); define('WP_DEBUG_DISPLAY', false); define('WP_DEBUG_LOG', true); . | Save file | .

786.title: Check Error Log
786.content: . | Via FTP, go to /wp-content/ | Open file: debug.log | Look at last entries | Error message will be there | .

787.title: Disable Debug Mode
787.content: When done troubleshooting: . | Edit wp-config.php | Change back to: define('WP_DEBUG', false); | Delete debug.log file | Save | .

788.title: When to Contact Support
788.content: Contact support if: . | ❌ You can’t install theme | ❌ Blank page and debug shows theme error | ❌ Theme features don’t work as documented | ❌ Need help customizing beyond basic options | . Don’t contact support for: . | ✅ Plugin compatibility (contact plugin author) | ✅ General WordPress help (check WordPress.org) | ✅ Hosting issues (contact hosting provider) | .

790.title: Self-Help Resources
790.content: . | FAQ Guide - Common questions | Getting Started Guide - Installation help | Common Tasks Guide - How-to guides | Theme Features Guide - Feature explanations | .

791.title: External Resources
791.content: . | WordPress.org support forums | Theme documentation website | Plugin documentation | Hosting provider support | .

792.title: Tools for Troubleshooting
792.content: . | WordPress Site Health tool (Tools → Site Health) | Browser Developer Tools (F12) | FTP client (FileZilla) | Text editor for wp-config.php | .

793.title: Quick Troubleshooting Flowchart
793.content: Seeing error or blank page? → Enable debug mode, check debug.log . Features not working? → Check plugin is activated, clear cache . Website looks wrong? → Clear browser cache, check theme options . Slow website? → Install caching plugin, optimize images . Can’t use page builder? → Check WPBakery activated, try different browser . Email not sending? → Check form email settings, contact hosting . Plugin conflict? → Deactivate plugins one by one until found .

794.title: Summary
794.content: Most issues have simple solutions: . | ✅ Clear caches (browser + plugin) | ✅ Update WordPress, plugins, theme | ✅ Increase memory limit if needed | ✅ Check plugin/theme is activated | ✅ Disable conflicting plugins | ✅ Use debug mode for errors | . Try these steps first before contacting support! . Still stuck? Check FAQ Guide or relevant guide above! 🆘 .

805.title: Shop General
805.content: . Default WooCommerce Store Notice, Product Catalog, Product Images & Checkout page settings in (Appearance->Customize->WooCommerce). | Product Archive Pages Layout - Page layout for shop, product category & product tag pages. | Primary Sidebar - Primary Sidebar for Product Archive Pages. | Secondary Sidebar - Secondary Sidebar for Product Archive Pages. | Shopping Cart Icon Location - Select the Shopping Cart Icon on primary or top menu. | Showing sorting options on Shop page - Enable or disable the Showing Number of Products Button on Shop page. | Showing Number of products options on shop page - Enable or disable the Showing Number of Products options on Shop page. | Enable Grid/List options button on shop page - Enable or disable the Grid/ List Button on Shop page. | Default Products Grid Or List View - Set WooCommerce Products display eather grid or list view. | Show Products Result Count - Display Products Result Count on the shop page. | Total Number of Products Per Page - Set WooCommerce Shop Page Total Number of Products Show Per Page. | Default of Products Per Column - Set WooCommerce Shop Page Number of Products Per Column. | Pagination Style - Shop archive page pagination styles. | .

806.title: Shop Product Card Structure
806.content: . | Product Card Style - Select the shop page product card style displays. | Show Product Card Fields - Select the product fields that want to show in shop archive pages. | Product Card Text Alignment - Select the shop page product card text alignment. | Fixed Product Image Height(px) - Make sure you have customize Product Images. If you still need to fixd the product image size then use this. | Show Product Sale Label As - Select product sale badge style. Note:- For the variable products, percent & price option will show the maximum sale price/percent. | Featured Products Badge/Label - Show badge/lable for featured products only. Note:- Leave blank to hide the featured product badge. | Show New Badge/Label - Show badge/lable for products added within the days! | Product shadow - Offset X(horizontal) & Offset Y(vertical) value can be negative. | Product Card Border Radius(px) - Enter the product card border radius (pixels). Default value is 0. | .

Note:- Shortcode supported. | Enable Catalog Mode - This will stop products purchasability. | .
